p.s: The Telegraph published a newspaper article by John Worne about language learning in the UK.
I read it and dealt with globalization and want to share my point of view regarding his claim that language learning is vital for the UK's future prosperity and global standing.
To my mind John Worne is only partly right.
He states, that foreign languages are necessary for trading, prosperity, cultural exports, diplomacy and national security.
Considering the work I have done I don't think it is essential, as English is the world language and every country that cares about their global standing is speaking English.
Nevertheless I share his opinion regarding the job advantage, as you can get a job easier in different countries.
I would say that this approach is also the right, in regard to the first claim.
It isn't necessary but it surleysurely helps as you have better connections to other countries.
